resources.string: Made with ❤️ by Ahmet Can Arslan
The theme has been updated. Please restart the app to apply the changes.
The font has been updated. Please restart the app to apply the changes.
Import successful. Please restart the app.
Are you sure you want to reset the app? This will disable the firewall (if active), clear all data, and close the app.
Some devices on Android 11 dont support ShizuWall. If you see an error like:\n - no command found set chain3 - \nit means your device is not supported and there is nothing to do at the moment.
If the error contains -no command found set chain 3-, your device is likely not supported on this Android version.
Warning: Firewall cleanup failed. Please REBOOT your device to restore internet access.

Action:
%1$s

Component:
%2$s

Extras:

%3$s (boolean) — true = enable, false = disable

%4$s (string, optional) — comma-separated package list to operate on. If omitted, app falls back to saved selected apps.


Examples:

Enable firewall for selected (selected in ShizuWall) apps:

adb shell am broadcast -a %1$s -n %2$s --ez %3$s true


Disable firewall for selected (selected in ShizuWall) apps:

adb shell am broadcast -a %1$s -n %2$s --ez %3$s false

Enable firewall for specific packages (CSV):

adb shell am broadcast -a %1$s -n %2$s --ez %3$s true --es %4$s "com.example.app1,com.example.app2"

Disable firewall for specific packages (CSV):

adb shell am broadcast -a %1$s -n %2$s --ez %3$s false --es %4$s "com.example.app1,com.example.app2"


Notes:

- The receiver is exported for adb automation; prefer targeting the receiver explicitly (for example: -n com.arslan.shizuwall/.receivers.FirewallControlReceiver) to avoid external broadcasts.

- Shizuku must be running and the app must have Shizuku permission for these broadcasts to succeed.

- The receiver applies the same commands as the UI (cmd connectivity ...). Use with care.
Block unwanted network connections without root or vpn
We need notification permission to keep you informed about firewall status if you reboot while firewall is active.
Long press on an app to add it to your favorites for quick access.
ShizuWall automatically filters out apps that don\'t have internet permission. This keeps your list clean and focused on apps that actually need firewall control.
The developer is not responsible for any negative consequences. Please install and activate Shizuku before proceeding.
ShizuWall can work in two modes. Shizuku is recommended for most users. LADB is an alternative that uses a local ADB daemon. Working Mode can be changed later

LADB mode allows ShizuWall to work by using a local ADB daemon. You will need to pair with Wireless Debugging once on LADB Setup page which located in settings. The developer is not responsible for any negative consequences.
Your Shizuku version is too old. Please update Shizuku to the latest version.
Shizuku permission is required for this app to work. Please grant the permission in Shizuku settings.
Notification permission denied. You won\'t see firewall status notifications.
Shizuku is not currently running. Start the Shizuku service (or install it) before enabling the firewall.
Shizuku version is too old, please update
Please grant Shizuku permission in settings
Please select at least one app
Do you want to enable firewall for %d apps listed below?
None of the selected apps are installed. Aborting.
selected apps are not installed and were ignored.
Failed to enable firewall for any apps
Failed to disable firewall for any apps

Include system applications in the list
Show selected apps at the beginning
Apply wallpaper colors to app theme
Apply rules instantly. Firewall stays on.
Automatically enable the firewall when the Shizuku service becomes available
Choose how Firewall commands are executed
Detect new installed apps and show a notification
Background service for monitoring new apps
Notifications when a new app is installed
Quick guide to use adb to control firewall
Save your configuration to a file
First of all you have to enable developer options. Afterwards open Shizuku app and press Pairing
Press developer options button, it\'ll redirect you there.
In here search for Wireless debugging and press that button, wireless debugging page will open.
Press pair device will pairing code.
When dialog opens, a notification will appear from Shizuku to allow you to enter the pairing code.
After confirming pairing code, return back to Shizuku and press start.
Wait until the service is active.
Open ShizuWall and try to enable Firewall.

Allow Shizuku permission, firewall be activated. Shizuku should be running when you enable or disable firewall toggle. After enabling firewall once, even if shizuku stops, firewall will remain active until you activate shizuku and disable it manually.

Pairing is required only once. Shizuku has to be activated again when device is rebooted. To enable and disable firewall, Shizuku has to be activated. If you want to use Shizuku without Wi-Fi (it has to be started via wifi before), enable USB debugging so Shizuku stays on until you reboot.
Would you like to view the Shizuku setup slides now? You can always open them later from the three-dot menu in Settings.
Select LADB mode first to configure LADB

Connection refused usually means Wireless debugging is OFF or you are using the wrong port. Use the port shown in Developer options → Wireless debugging → IP address & port (not the pairing port). Also make sure ShizuWall is allowed in Wireless debugging.
Tap and enter the pairing port and code shown in Wireless debugging → Pair device.
Tap and enter the pairing code shown in Wireless debugging → Pair device.
Pairing succeeded. You can now connect.
Open ShizuWall to see the error log.
Missing pairing code. Enter it from Wireless debugging → Pair device.
Missing pairing port. Enter: PORT CODE (from Wireless debugging → Pair device).
Notification permission is required to show the pairing code prompt.
Pair LADB and install the persistent background daemon
No logs yet. Perform LADB operations to see logs here.

This working mode uses a background helper Daemon to manage your firewall rules.

Quick Start Guide:
- Make sure you are connected to Wi-Fi
- Enable 'Wireless Debugging and Usb debugging (to keep helper alive without Wi-Fi connection)' in Developer Options
- Tap the button below to start the helper

First Time Setup:
If you haven't paired before, the button will open Developer Options. Go to 'Wireless Debugging' -> 'Pair device with pairing code'. A notification will appear—just enter the code there.

Important: Android stops the helper when you restart your phone. You'll need to tap the button again after every reboot to keep Daemon alive.

Important2: If you do not enable usb debugging, this working mode will only work when you have a Wi-Fi connection. Because if you disconnect from wi-fi it'll stop daemon and firewall cannot be enabled or disabled.
Show detailed LADB and Daemon configuration
Daemon is not running. Please start it from the setup page.
Failed to update rules for %d apps
ShizuWall needs notification permission to show the pairing code notification.\n\nWithout this permission, you won\'t be able to enter the pairing code easily.
Notification permission is required to use the LADB pairing feature. This permission allows us to show important pairing information.\n\nPlease grant notification permission to proceed.
Enter pairing code from wireless debugging page into notification.
No connection configuration found. Wait for auto-discovery or check wireless debugging.
Firewall should be enabled again after rebooting. Tap to open the app.

Connection failed. Please check:
1. Wireless debugging is enabled in Developer options
2. The device is on the same network
3. No firewall is blocking the connection
Shizuku not available or permission denied
